intro: Chartoloma platycarpum, commonly known as the broad-fruited chartoloma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the family.
